title.narrative: 1.4.4 IMPLEMENT INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Ministry of Education, Ministry of Primary and Mass Education and partners at national and local levels have capacities to implement inclusive Education., which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, women, children and youth in 20 selected districts, demand and benefit from increased and more equitable utilization of quality health, nutrition, population, education, water, sanitation and HIV services

sector.narrative: System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget

title.narrative: Percentage of School Management Committee members/Union Parshad members oriented on Inclusive Education including mainstreaming children with disability in 20 UNDAF districts
%age of secondaryu schools implementing LSBE in secondary schools
Number and proportion of primary schools implementing EiE and DRR

actual.value: 2016:Data not available, Current routine administrative data does not reflect this indicator. UNICEF is advocating to include one indicator on EiE and DRR into the KPI or PSQL for the next primary education development programme.

title.narrative: Percentage of girls and boys from ethnic minorities receiving formal pre-primary and lower primary education their mother languages in three Chittang Hill Districts (CHT)

actual.value: 2016:Data not available, Implementation of mother tongue education for ethnic minorities will start in 2017
